{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3657827,"name":"Doruk Yılmaz","username":"drk_yilmaz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/7ba0ec/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T07:24:40.721Z","cooked":"

Our robot’s network appears on the computer, we enter the password but the network cannot be connected. We have closed all firewalls. Our communications led is lighting up. When we connect the Ethernet cable, it appears on the computer but does not provide internet. When we do ping the internet it does ping us back. What can be wrong?

WhatsApp Image 2025-06-19 at 10.19.04 (1)2048×1536 402 KB

WhatsApp Image 2025-06-19 at 10.19.041536×2048 404 KB

What exactly are you trying to do?
It is expected that when connected to the robots network that you will only have access to the local network and not the internet.

We want to view our limelight from the limelight hardware manager but we can’t view it because we can’t connect to the internet. I know that the computer needs to be connected to the robot network.

So, to be clear, does it say ‘Connected without internet’ or does it say ‘Can’t connect to this network’?

It looks like your PC is on the roboRIO USB connected network and your LimeLight is on the Ethernet connected network. You need PORT FORWARDING to send the LL data to the PC. I think LL docs and WPILib docs have examples. Here’s a partial example - change and add ports that you are needing:

  public void robotInit() {
    // Replace with your team number and Limelight's hostname/IP
    PortForwarder.add(5801, "limelight.local", 5801); // Forwarding the config port
    PortForwarder.add(5800, "limelight.local", 5800); // Forwarding the video port
","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2025-06-19T13:58:54.811Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":94,"readers_count":93,"score":38.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":503367,"topic_slug":"internet-problem","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/internet-problem/503367/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3658066,"name":"Doruk Yılmaz","username":"drk_yilmaz","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/7ba0ec/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-06-19T18:08:41.219Z","cooked":"

Ok, we solved the problem, thank you all.
